articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Brought Out in Mexico 
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il's famous work "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation" was brought out in pamphlet by the Workers' Party of Mexico Publishing House.
 Clarified in the work, published on April 18, Juche 87 (1998), is the historic five-point policy of great national unity which serves as important guidelines in achieving the great unity of the Korean nation.    
 The five-point policy contains the requirements that the whole nation should base itself on the principle of national independence, unite under the banner of patriotism, the banner of national reunification, improve inter-Korean relations, struggle against outside domination and interference and the anti-reunification forces, and have contacts, develop dialogue and strengthen solidarity.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Terrorist Acts Denounced
articles.content:
Meeting for Solidarity with Korean People in Mexico 
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- A meeting for solidarity with the Korean people was held at the building of the Puebla State Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico on July 21.
 Addressing the meeting, coordinator of the Puebla State Committee of the WPM Camilo Torres Mejia and other figures expressed full support and solidarity with the just cause of the Korean people who are building a great prosperous powerful socialist nation and waging a vigorous struggle for national reunification, while resolutely smashing the more undisguised moves of the U.S. imperialists to stifle the DPRK under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.    
 A letter of solidarity to leader Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting.

Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire
Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire 
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on August 1 sent a message of greetings to Laurent Gbagbo, President of Cote d'Ivoire, on the occasion of the 43rd anniversary of its independence.
 In the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message wished the president and people of Cote d'Ivoire greater success in the work for the stability, peace and prosperity of the country.
